title: MySQLLOCALTIME()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLLOCALTIME()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return current date and time:
SELECT 
  LOCALTIME();

Definition and Usage
The LOCALTIME() function returns the current date and time.
Note:
The date and time is returned as "YYYY-MM-DD HH-MM-SS" 
(string) or as YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.uuuuuu (numeric).
Syntax
LOCALTIME()
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return current date and time + 1:
SELECT 
  LOCALTIME() + 1;

★
+1

quiz.question: What is The date and time?
options:
returned as "YYYY-MM-DD HH-MM-SS" 
(string) or as YYYYMMDDHHMMSS
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of The date and time is 'returned as "YYYY-MM-DD HH-MM-SS" 
(string) or as YYYYMMDDHHMMSS'.

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLLOCALTIME()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLLOCALTIME()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLLOCALTIME()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
